## Discussion

The table view calls this method on the main queue to cancel prefetch requests for cells that are no longer needed. Use this method to cancel operations initiated by a previous call to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSourcePrefetching/tableView(_:prefetchRowsAt:)].

For information about how to cancel an asynchronous data loading task, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/ConcurrencyProgrammingGuide/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008091].

# tableView(_:cancelPrefetchingForRowsAt:)

**Instance Method**

Cancels a previously triggered data prefetch request.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func tableView(_ tableView: UITableView, cancelPrefetchingForRowsAt indexPaths: [IndexPath])
```

## Parameters

- **tableView**: The table view issuing the cancellation of the prefetch request.
- **indexPaths**: The index paths of the items for which the data is no longer required.

## Discussion

The table view calls this method on the main queue to cancel prefetch requests for cells that are no longer needed. Use this method to cancel operations initiated by a previous call to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSourcePrefetching/tableView(_:prefetchRowsAt:)].

For information about how to cancel an asynchronous data loading task, see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/ConcurrencyProgrammingGuide/Introduction/Introduction.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008091].

## Fetching the row data

- **tableView(_:prefetchRowsAt:)**: Instructs your prefetch data source object to begin preparing data for the cells at the supplied index paths.
